Life is Strange 2 is a beautifully made, emotional story that absolutely deserves recognition—but for me, it just didn’t hit the same way as the original. That’s not to say it isn’t good—because it really is. The journey of Sean and Daniel is powerful, full of heart and difficult choices, and it explores themes like brotherhood, identity, and survival in a way that’s raw and deeply moving. The writing is strong, the art style is familiar and comforting, and the moral weight of your decisions is as heavy as ever. But despite all that, it didn’t quite leave the same lasting imprint that Max and Chloe’s story did. Still, if you love narrative-driven games or the Life is Strange series in general, it’s definitely worth playing.

I consider myself a fan of choice-based games, and among many of them, I feel a deep connection with Life is Strange 2. I believe this game resonates with my life due to the various situations and decisions one must face, and the consequences that come with them. It reflects the responsibility and weight a person must carry in life. It’s a calm and slow-paced game, yet it delivers a powerful message, touching on sensitive topics that are still relevant today—and likely will continue to be. If you’re going to play it, make sure to pay attention to everything around you and to the dialogues. With that said, I hope you enjoy this game as much as I did.

Life is Strange 2 is not a bad game overall, but it definitely has its flaws. Sometimes the story has really silly moments, and some choices lead to strange or unrealistic consequences. Compared to the first game, the second part feels weaker and less impactful. That said, it’s still a decent experience, especially if you're into narrative-driven games. A lot of the game depends on the younger brother, which can be interesting but also frustrating at times.

ENG:
Life is Strange 2 delivers an emotional and thought-provoking journey, driven by strong character development and meaningful choices. The writing feels authentic, and the relationship dynamics evolve naturally, making every decision impactful. While the pacing can be slow at times, the story’s depth and emotional weight keep it engaging. The soundtrack and art direction enhance the atmosphere beautifully. Some players may find the lack of traditional gameplay elements limiting, but the narrative strength makes up for it. It’s a powerful experience that lingers long after the credits roll.

RO:
Life is Strange 2 oferă o experiență emoționantă și profundă, susținută de o dezvoltare puternică a personajelor și alegeri semnificative. Dialogurile sunt autentice, iar dinamica relațiilor evoluează natural, făcând fiecare decizie importantă. Deși ritmul poate fi lent uneori, profunzimea poveștii și impactul emoțional mențin interesul ridicat. Coloana sonoră și direcția artistică completează perfect atmosfera. Unii jucători ar putea considera lipsa elementelor tradiționale de gameplay ca fiind o limitare, dar forța narativă compensează acest aspect. Este o experiență puternică, care rămâne cu tine mult timp după ce se termină jocul.

developer: DONTNOD Entertainment, Feral Interactive (Mac), Feral Interactive (Linux)
short_description: After a tragic incident, brothers Sean and Daniel Diaz run away from home. Fearing the police, and dealing with Daniel's new telekinetic power, the boys head to Mexico. Each stop on their journey brings new friends and new challenges.
